resources.string: If you're not Marauder, you're nothing.
We need more 'real' warriors around here.\n\nThis is the battle that counts.

We need more 'real' warriors around here.

This is the battle that counts.

[ Level 58 required for Shattered Mountain faction missions ]
Simple minds will find little traction communicating with the enlightened.
Ah, I have your name whispered in quiet places.\n\nYou see the truth, and where you not see it, you search.

Ah, I have your name whispered in quiet places.

You see the truth, and where you not see it, you search.

[ Level 58 required for Shattered Mountain faction missions ]
The Spark requires fuel for its sustenance.\n\nFaith cannot exist in vacuum. I hope you realize this some day.
Watch yourself in Shattered Mountain, my courageous colleague.\n\nEven those of great faith can fall to Corruption this close to source.

Watch yourself in Shattered Mountain, my courageous colleague.

Even those of great faith can fall to Corruption this close to source.

[ Level 58 required for Shattered Mountain faction missions ]

I have been awaiting you, {playerName}. I know all about the twisted lies that have darkened your past trials.\n\nI am proud that you have held close to the Spark and are now prepared for your final trial.

I have been awaiting you, {playerName}. I know all about the twisted lies that have darkened your past trials.

I am proud that you have held close to the Spark and are now prepared for your final trial.

[ Level 58 required for Shattered Mountain faction missions ]
The Spark shines brightest in the darkest hours. \n\nWe must rally to face and destroy the menace of Corruption. Light guide your path, Adjudicator.

The Spark shines brightest in the darkest hours. 

We must rally to face and destroy the menace of Corruption. Light guide your path, Adjudicator.

[ Level 58 required for Shattered Mountain faction missions ]
I must confess - even I am beginning to feel hopeless in the face of such evil.\n\nThe Corrupted are relentless and they seem to know when and where to strike.
At this point, I've been watching for Corruption or fighting against it as long as I can remember.\n\nIf that means my mind is sliding, then let it slide, I say! I'm in this until the end.
From far away, the Shattered Mountain looks rather intimidating.\n\nBut up close… well, I suppose it still looks quite ominous, doesn't it?
Always good to see another regular old human being here in the outpost.\n\nNow don't you go getting Corrupted now, you hear?
Somehow, some way, we must find a path that leads inside the Mountain itself.\n\nWe have deployed scouts to discover this path. Let's just hope they return.
No word from Clarion in some time.\n\nIf the Corrupted overcome our position there, this fort will be next.
So you managed to knock the Corruption off-balance around this hellish place…\n\nThat helps, now we just need to get through to Clarion.
Welcome to Shattered Mountain, Warden. \n\nThis is the front line in the battle against the Corruption.
I'm beginning to have doubts about our position here.\n\nEvery time I go out for reconnaissance, it seems the Corrupted are gaining ground.
In my time on Aeternum, I've seen darkness to terrify anyone in the Old World.\n\nBut I've never seen anything as insidious as the way the Corrupted bolster their ranks.
I've walked these lands for as long as I can remember.\n\nIt's always been a dark place, but never quite so apocalyptic.
Mind yourself if you leave the outpost.\n\nSeems half the people who leave… never return.
Shattered Mountain is hardly a comfortable place, but we do what we can.\n\nWelcome to the 'Last Beacon', friend. Make yourself at home.
This maybe an outpost on the front lines, but I tolerate no messiness, understand?\n\nYou're welcome to the 'Riven Shield', but clean up after yourself.
Hello there, I'm Master Fisher Bernard.
There are still battles to be had for the resources of this land. Are you interested?
Alligator Steaks
Hunt Shattered Alligators for Gator Steaks and seek out bundles of Mirespice Blend held by the Desolate Scroungers. Then report back to Warden Douglas in Shattered Mountain.
Well, I don't know - I thought we were doing quite well against the Corrupted, but… then we weren't.\n\nNow we're doing better, but I'm afraid to believe it. Does that make sense?
Look here, it's my old friend, {playerName}. I wondered if you had joined the Soulwardens.\n\nThat day back on the beach of Monarch's Bluffs kinda feels like a dream now.
"I know exactly what you mean."

I've been trying to think of a way to cheer people up, but it's just not a cheery place.\n\nBut doesn't a hearty meal always help? Maybe we could try those weird steaks the Rangers eat… Add a good spice…
"It's worth a try, I guess."

That's the enthusiasm we need here! Yes! Gator meat: delicious. Probably? And how dangerous can Shattered Alligators actually be? For you. Ahem.\n\nMix in some Mirespice Blend, and who knows? Something tasty. Uhh… surely. Yes... Yes! You gather it, I'll cook it. Deal?
Shattered Gator Meat and Mirespice Blend, and then we'll be cooking… or is it better to eat it raw?

I may have had… second thoughts… while you were away.\n\nBut we've all been subsisting on dry rations around here, so I'll… I'll… I'll prepare it, at least. Yes, I am very confident in this recipe! Ahem.
Honestly, I don't know if I'll be able to bring myself to eat it. I mean, gator?\n\nIt's not like I have a weak stomach, but… maybe our rations aren't so bad, you know?
Enter the {POITags} and seek out the ingredients
Collect {itemName} from the Alligators of the {POITags}
Recover {itemName} from the Scroungers in {POITags}
Clarion Offensive
Defeat Dau-Shin and recover Armor Scraps from the Rockrift Carvers in Limbus Cavatus. Then report back to Warden Fayed in Shattered Mountain.

For too long we have been able to do little while Corruption spreads down from the mountain.\n\nI know you are preparing your assault against the enemy, but we need defensive measures in place to blunt any preemptive strike by the Tempest.
If it isn't my friend {playerName} from the beach in Windsward. Long ago, that seems now.\n\nWith those rituals disrupted, we can more easily prepare a stronger bulwark here.
"That's a great idea."
I'm glad you agree. Before we can do so, however, we have to make ourselves less vulnerable.\n\nThe weapons the Corrupted wield seem to slice through our armor like it's not even there.
"We could reinforce the armor."

What a thought! The armor of the Ancients Guardians in Limbus Cavatus - that might hold.\n\nBut there is one Guardian in particular who blocks my access - Dau-Shin. Defeat Dau-Shin and collect any armor scraps you can. Godspeed, my friend.
If we can get some of the armor from Limbus Cavatus, it will help us withstand the Corrupted.\n\nDau-Shin must be defeated first.

Aha, a successful mission, I presume? Yes, Dau-Shin defeated and these armor scraps will do nicely.\n\nI will see them broken down and used to reinforce the Warden's armors. Then, my friend... then we will be ready for anything.
Your presence here is more than an inspiration, my friend.\n\nIt is a lifeline for the Soulwardens who have grown weary fighting on the front lines.
Confront the Ancient Guardians of {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} in the depths of {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Guardians' Secrets
Defeat Guardian Tzi-Wang, recover Baetylus Luckstones, and defeat Rockruins Guardians in Limbus Cavatus. Then report back to Warden Reese in Shattered Mountain.
Perhaps there's hope for us yet, eh? Not that I was actually starting to lose hope, mind you.\n\nBut now that you're here, I think we can aim a little higher than just… holding out.
"What did you have in mind?"
Well, I'm no bookish researcher like William Heron, but you have to admit - those Ancients knew some things.\n\nThe Corrupted actually give some of the old ruins a wide berth.
"You think we can use this?"

One would hope. I tried to check the Limbus Cavatus but there's a big bugger of a Guardian called Tzi-Wang.\n\nIf you can defeat the Guardian and look for anything that might repel Corruption, it would be... glorious.
Limbus Cavatus is certainly a hike, I know... but it's worth a shot.

Hey, you made it back! That bony wretch didn't give you too much trouble, I hope? \n\nAnd what are these? Baetylus Luckstones? I wonder if that's what repels the Corruption. William Heron, never around when you need him.
Delve into {POITags} and seek the Ancient Guardians' secrets
Eliminate {targetName}
Defeat {targetName} Guardians
Collect {itemName}
Pushing Back
Eliminate the Corrupted in Weeping-and-Gnashing and Corpus Angoris, and recover any supplies left behind. Then report back to Warden Reese in Shattered Mountain.
You know what I keep asking myself? How exactly did I wind up here?\n\nI just joined the Soulwardens a few weeks ago, and now I'm here, on the front lines against Corruption. It's madness.
Well now, imagine seeing you here, {playerName}. I had a feeling you joined the Soulwardens.\n\nWe're a long way from that Watchtower in Everfall, though, aren't we?
"Tell me about it."

It feels like the Corrupted keep getting stronger - I'm not sure how much longer we can defend this spot.\n\nEvery day, they push us farther from the mountain, and any chance of striking at the source.
"But we've begun pushing back."

That is true. You've brought fresh spirit! And maybe now really is the time to push even more weight behind that momentum…\n\nIf we're going to strike back, first place to start is the two forts they've captured to the south.
"We could retake the forts."

We don't need to retake the forts - just weaken the Corrupted enough so supplies can get through to Clarion.\n\nBlast the hell out of them… and try to recover some of the supplies we left behind. We need them.
Weaken the Corrupted's position in the forts so we can get supplies through to Clarion. \n\nReclaim any supplies you find in those forts as well.
That was quite impressive, but somehow I'm not surprised. Now we can finally re-establish supply lines with Clarion.\n\nAnd Charity's been hoping to recover some of this Orichalcum and Starmetal.
Travel to {POITags} and strike a blow against the Corruption
Continue your attack on the Corrupted in {POITags}
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Search containers for {itemName}
You know... I just remembered a legend about a 'Baetylus Headpiece'…\n\nIt's been a long time, though. Probably just some old fishwives' tale. No need to risk the Lazarus Well, that's for sure.
Baetylus Headpiece (Expedition)
Defeat the Cilla in the Lazarus Instrumentality Expedition and Collect the Naga Headdress. Then report back to Warden Reese in Shattered Mountain.
"The Lazarus Instrumentality?"
Definitely a dodgy place, in Reekwater. If you can find others as mad as you, it might be worth it.\n\nLegends say there's some Naga in there, headpiece made of Baetylus… could be quite useful.
Are you really going to venture into the Lazarus Instrumentality…?\n\nJust be careful. I think we still need you in the fight against Corruption.

Welcome back to the front, {playerName}. Wait, the Lazarus Instrumentality? You can't mean…\n\nWell I'll be a sea turtle's nephew… you got the Naga Headdress too? I guess we'll have to get this looked at. Amazing work!
There must be some way we can put these Baetylus Luckstones to work?\n\nMaybe swallow them? I'll not be the one to try that, I suppose. Let's hope this Headpiece gives us answers.
Venture into the Lazarus Instrumentality Expedition
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Knowledge is Power
Get a fresh blight sample from a Blight Nodule in Wanhope Wold. Then report back to Ranger Herath in Shattered Mountain.
How splendid, another intrepid adventurer out in the wilds!\n\nIf we are to be victorious, however, we are going to have put our knowledge to work.
"What knowledge?"

We know some of the Corrupted in Edengrove have proven susceptible to the Blight.\n\nThe Corrupted near the Mountain are of a different class altogether, but perhaps they suffer from the same weakness.
"How can we find out?"
I already have a sample of Corruption, but I'll need fresh Blight samples collected nearby. \n\nWith fresh samples I can begin investigating further. Be careful when collecting some!
If you can get me fresh Blight samples, I can do the rest.
Aha, the procurer of the ingredients for my experiment!\n\nLet us see how these elements interact… yes, the Corruption certainly can't take hold, and in fact, it is weakened. This will work.
Travel to {POITags} to obtain the Corrupted Essence
Venture into the {POITags} and seek out a Blight Nodule
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} Corrupted
Locate a gathering of Putridspore Cultivators
Gather {itemName} from a Blight Nodule
Blight Resistance

string.comment: male referring to male (Fay the Last Protector)
string.speaker: UI - Journal - Quest Description

resources.string: Collect a Blight Sample from the Baleful Lair and defeat Fay, the Last Protector. Bring a piece of his remains to Ranger Herath in Shattered Mountain.
If we can harness the putrescent horror of the Blight to fight the Corrupted, we can win this.\n\nThe problem is that we can't safely handle the Blight ourselves.
"Does anything resist the Blight?"

string.comment: male referring to male (Survivalist Ellwood), male referring to male (Fay the Last Protector)
string.speaker: Ranger Herath
string.name: RangerHerath

resources.string: Ah, now that you mention it, I did notice some Angry Earth in the region that seem impervious.\n\nThey are led by a particularly fierce Dryad simply known as Fay - I suspect he would be trouble, even for you.
"I'll try nonetheless."

string.comment: male referring to male (Survivalist Ellwood), male referring to male (Fay the Last Protector)
string.speaker: Ranger Herath
string.name: RangerHerath

resources.string: Very well. Bring me back some piece of Fay himself and I'll need another Blight Sample from closer to the Mountain.\n\nThen we might be able to learn the secret of their resistance.

string.comment: male referring to male (Fay the Last Protector)
string.speaker: Ranger Herath
string.name: RangerHerath

resources.string: Fay and his band of Dryads are a force unto themselves.\n\nProceed with caution - my hopes go with you.

string.comment: male referring to male (Survivalist Ellwood), male referring to male (Fay the Last Protector)
string.speaker: Ranger Herath
string.name: RangerHerath

resources.string: Wait, you faced down Fay and survived to return? I must confess, I had my doubts.\n\nI am very happy to see they were unfounded. Now, let's see what we can learn from what you've recovered.
"A resistance to the Blight?"

string.comment: male referring to male (Survivalist Ellwood), male referring to male (Fay the Last Protector)
string.speaker: Ranger Herath
string.name: RangerHerath

resources.string: Ah… yes, indeed. Fay's briars are resistant. Now, if I can synthesize this substance into our gloves…\n\nI have much work to do, but I am confident this will help us wield the Blight as a weapon.
Travel to {POITags} and collect the Blight Sample
Continue to {POITags} and seek out Fay, the Last Protector
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}

string.comment: targetName = "Fay the Last Protector" , POI = "Spryla Tower" , itemName = "Fays Briars"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Claim {itemName} from {targetName}
Ultimate Blight Defense (Expedition)
Defeat the Alluvium Marl and Collect Alluvium Spores for Ranger Herath in Shattered Mountain.
There is another idea that forced itself into my mind.\n\nI hesitate to ask, however, as it would require you to visit the Garden of Genesis in Edengrove.
"The Garden of Genesis?"
Yes, a sacred place for the Angry Earth, perhaps the most sacred.\n\nThere is said to be a… "thing" there, so organically potent, its spores can protect against anything.
"I can go get these spores."

Do not be overconfident. I've never seen anyone return from the Garden of Genesis.\n\nIf you go, take friends… and seek out the Alluvium Marl - its spores are said to have primal defenses. Go in strength, friend.
The Alluvium Marl in the Garden of Genesis… \n\nI have no idea what to expect… other than it being likely one of the most dangerous creatures in all Aeternum.
Well, this is truly beyond the pale - you're the first I've seen venture into the Garden and return.\n\nYou got the Alluvium spores as well? These… now these will give us the upper hand. Well done!
I still can't get over the fact that you ventured into the Garden of Genesis and returned.\n\nYou'll have to tell me all about it someday.
Venture into the Garden of Genesis
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Malevolent Offerings

End the rituals in Hewn-from-Hell and Mantled-in-Nettles by eliminating the Corrupted Vicars, their guards, and their Corruption Barbs, then reclaim their Corrupted ritual implements. Then report back to Warden Linch in Shattered Mountain.
If I was a woman of faith, I'd say you were sent straight from the heavens.\n\nBut I suspect your journey here was not quite so blessed.
Aye, you've crossed my mind more than once, {playerName}. That day back in First Light seems a lifetime ago.\n\nSomehow though, I'm not terribly surprised we both wound up as Soulwardens.
"We do what we must, right?"

Aye, and now we fight for our very souls, and those of every living creature on the face of the Earth.\n\nThe Corrupted here are practicing dark magics that we can't comprehend... but we had better put a stop to that immediately.
"What dark magic?"
The Corrupted Vicars are working some kind of rituals.\n\nEvery pulse, it's like a wave of temptation mixed with rage. Whatever they're doing, you've got to stop it... while you still can.
Whatever it takes, break up those rituals, destroy the Vicars, and take the implements of their evil. \n\nThat way they can't recreate their rituals even if they come back.
Finally, an end to those infernal rituals! I can feel the difference already. We all can.\n\nWhatever they were doing, it was driving us mad. You've saved our forces from certain doom, I tell you.
It was no small thing dealing with those vicars and that loathsome ritual.\n\nAs long as we can keep our wits, we've got a fighting chance at least.
Assault {POITags} and smite the servants of the Corrupted Vicars
Put an end to the rituals in {POITags} and strike down the Corrupted Vicars
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName}
The Illurmin Rift
Explore the deadly Illurmin Rift and deliver your discoveries to Warden Linch in Shattered Mountain.
The fact is simply that the Corrupted grow in strength and numbers by the hour.\n\nIt may be best to get as far away from the Mountain as possible.
"Should I warn the Soulwardens?"

Yes, but I wouldn't take the road.\n\nThere's some vile Corrupted down in the Illurmin Rift, like something straight from hell, and I worry they're prepping to attack both here and the Soulwarden War Camp.
"I can investigate on the way."
Certainly brave of you - I just hope you can get through without becoming Corrupted yourself.\n\nCollect whatever you can from these hellish minions in the Rift and get to Warden Linch. Go quickly.
The things coming out of the Rift are scary enough to make you mess your smallclothes if you're not prepared.\n\nHave courage, and for azoth's sake, watch your back.
I'll be a weathered knob on an Angry Spriggan's arse! Someone finally made it through!\n\nFirst one to come in from Clarion in quite some time, and through the Illurmin Rift, to boot!
If the Tempest is gone, then these infernal Corrupted will have to let up at some point.\n\nI'd say this is cause for celebration.
There you are! The hero of the hour. \n\nOne of these days, you'll have to give me the full story of how you brought down the Tempest.
Descend into the Illurmin Rift
Continue reconnaissance of the Illurmin Rift
Ascend from the Illurmin Rift and travel to the Soulwarden War Camp
Proceed into {POITags} and continue scouting the Corrupted
Report to {POITags}
In Lamentations:
In Apostate Nave:
Cut down {targetName} for {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Carve {itemName} from {targetName}
Obtain {itemName} from {targetName}
Madaki's Stratagem
Search the forges of Infernal Host for any weapon molds or crucibles they might be using to forge weapons of great power. Then report back to Ranger Madaki in Shattered Mountain.
The Corrupted have found a way to use Ancient forging techniques to craft new weapons.\n\nI’ve uncovered pages that show some details as to the process.
"Can we do the same?"

Possibly. My study has indicated they need unique molds to properly complete each weapon.\n\nIf the Corrupted are attempting to forge such things, it would be deep within Infernal Host. Someone will need to go there.
"I can go."

Even you might face some challenge in there... I suggest you find some allies before departing.\n\nIf you are able to reach the forges, search for any molds or crucibles they're using. Bring them back and we'll see…
If it is possible to use these Ancient forging techniques, that is an advantage we need to deny the Corrupted…

You've returned. I'm impressed and cautiously optimistic. You found the crucibles?\n\nAmazing. With these, we can forge a great variety of weapon types. I will share them amongst all the Rangers and Wardens.
Travel to {POITags}
Search for {itemName}
Our Own Worst Enemy
Search for Soulwarden Heartgems across the five forts in Shattered Mountain, and search for any Corrupted writings. Then report back to Ranger Madaki in Shattered Mountain.

Did you know the Corrupted have their own language? I don't have enough samples to translate it yet. \n\nBut I'm hoping to someday transloate it to learn what dark magic's involved in this insidious way they bolster their ranks.
"What are they doing?"

Bah, same as they do in the Cleave and everywhere else - they turn our own against us.\n\nThat's right, every time a Soulwarden falls, a Corrupted rises in their place. We're fighting our comrades out there.
"Aren't we protected?"

Not against this… whatever it is. But maybe we can figure it out by venturing back into our forts.\n\nHelp me recover some of the Corrupted Wardens' Heartgems, and any Corrupted writings you find. I'll at least try to translate 'em.
Get me as many Heartgems as you can find and any Corrupted Writings. \n\nHonestly, it's the only chance we've got to stop this madness.
Let's see what we can do with the materials you've managed to collect.

Well I'll be damned, you got more Heartgems than I expected. Sad is what that is.\n\nBut let's see these writings... hm, this is interesting - it's written by a Warden as he was falling to the Corruption.
"Can it protect from Corruption?"
I'm not sure, but I might be able use this to finally decipher the Corrupted language.\n\nThis is going to take some time... but already I see some things quite clearly.
Travel to {POITags} and search for Soulwarden Heartgems
Continue your search for Heartgems at {POITags}
Within Nomine Damnis:
Within Corpus Angoris:
Within Weeping-And-Gnashing:
Within Mantled-In-Nettles:
Within Hewn-From-Hell:
Determine if fallen Soulwardens are present
Collect {itemName}
Search for 'Broken Branches' journal entry
Search for 'Pruning a Twisted Vine' journal entry
Search for 'Condensing Corruption' journal entry
Search for 'Duality of the Word' journal entry
Search for 'A Sinister Intent' journal entry
Path to Myrkgard

Travel to Myrkgard and destroy the Corrupted Monoliths and Portals, collecting the Orbs hidden at each. Combine the Orbs with Captain Thorpe's Corrupted Aura to form the Myrkgard Arena Key, unlocking the Arena behind the Myrkgard Cathedral.\n\n[This Quest can be shared and repeated.]
You have done all that you can and more for us here in the outpost, Warden.\n\nI think you know where you are needed next.
"I need to enter the Mountain."
Indeed. We believe the Tempest is down beneath the ruins of Myrkgard, but getting in there won't be easy. \n\nWe believe the only way to enter the portals from which we see the Corrupted emerging.
"How do I enter the portals?"

We believe they can only be unlocked by taking the Orbs from the Corrupted Monoliths near the Cathedral.\n\nWhat you'll face when you go through, I tremble to imagine. I suggest you gather other Wardens before you go. All hope goes with you…

Make sure to rally some other Wardens to your side, and then collect the Orbs from the Monoliths.\n\nThat will open the portal to take you… who knows where. If anyone can do this, you can. Godspeed, Warden.
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Travel to {POITags}
Collect {itemName}
Collect Orbs from Corrupted Monoliths and Portals
Defeat Captain Thorpe at the Myrkgard Cathedral
Complete Quest: Tower of Terrors
Complete Quest: Maw of Corruption
Complete Quest: Unhallowed Flesh
Complete Quest: Corrupted Forge
Complete Quest: Secret of Eridanus

Complete Weaver's Weave
Venture to {POITags} and search for Enchanted Bark
Defeat {targetName} Dryads

Recover the source of the Maw's power at {POITags}

resources.string: Defeat {targetName} for a {itemName}
Delve deep into the Mangled Heights to collect Corrupted Flesh
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted for {itemName}

string.comment: target= High Priest Oseguera, item= Pound of Corrupted Flesh

resources.string: Defeat {targetName} for a {itemName}
Travel to Caminus in search of ingots and a whetstone
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted for {itemName}s

string.comment: target= Caminus Gate Lord, item= Runic Whetstone

resources.string: Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Journey to Eridanus to collect weapon wrappings from the Dryads
Defeat {targetName} Dryads
Defeat Eridanite Periderm for {itemName}
Brave the Ancient tower Scorpius for Corrupted Blood
Defeat Scorpii Pluton
Scrape Defiled Altars for {itemName}
Travel to {POITags} in search of Azoth Oil
Defeat {targetName} Lost
Search chests for {itemName}
Travel to {POITags} in search of Sanctified Leather
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName} Undead for {itemName}
Forging Twilight's Fall
Tower of Terrors
Maw of Corruption
Unhallowed Flesh
Corrupted Forge
Secret of Eridanus
Scorpius
Lost Materials
Weaver's Weave
Recover the components needed to forge Twilight's Fall and deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
Travel to Edengrove and recover a powerful component from the Dryads of Malevolence.
Travel to the western side of the Great Cleave and recover the Maw's source of power.
Travel to the Mangled Heights in Great Cleave and collect Corrupted Flesh. Once heated in the forge, it will enable the blade to harm even the most well guarded of Corrupted foes.
Travel to Caminus to recover ingots from the Bloodforged Corrupted. The Gate Keeper is also said to possess a mystical whetstone that will aid the blade's honing.
Journey to Eridanus in Restless Shore and claim weapon wrappings from the Dryads.
Mourningdale is the next leg of your journey. Face their swordsmen and claim Corrupted Blood from the vile swarmers that pollute the place.
Travel to Brightwood Isle and search for Azoth Oil to preserve the blade.
Travel to Weaver's Fen and claim leather from the Periville Undead.
I've been studying the materials Ranger Madaki has shared around.\n\nThere's a legendary sword and shield that could be forged.
"What materials are required?"

I can only decipher what's needed for the blade... Twilight's Fall, as I've taken to calling it.\n\nCollecting these elements will take you all over Aeternum. Are you certain you wish to undertake this?
"Yes, I'm certain."
Very well, travel this accursed isle and collect the required ingredients for Twilight's Fall.\n\nThen bring everything to Ranger Madaki; she can forge it, and perhaps she can help with the shield.
You have undertaken a long journey, my friend.\n\nBut I believe Twilight's Fall will be a weapon fit for a warrior-poet. Godspeed.

Ah, I see you've taken over Ranger Demir's work, acquiring the elements for Twilight's Fall.\n\nYes, this is the blade of champions. Wield it with pride. It suits you well. But you will want a shield to accompany it, yes?
"That would be nice."
Perfect, we've taken to calling this design 'Boundless Ward.' It will be the strongest shield ever forged.\n\nAcquire the elements for me and I will forge it and strap it on your arm myself.
A longsword without a sister shield is like a missing limb. \n\nStart your journey with confidence. I look forward to your return and testing my smithing skills.
You're back, good. With these materials I can forge the strongest shield in all of Aeternum. \n\nThere…. Boundless Ward. This will defend against Corruption, and anything else, for that matter.
Forging Boundless Ward
Scorched Mines
Tangled Tribulations
Upper Harrows
Divine Opulence
Recover the components needed to forge Boundles Ward and deliver them to Ranger Madaki in Mountainhome.
Venture to Ambusti Superior in Shattered Mountains. The Corrupted have vital raw materials needed to forge Boundless Ward.
Travel to The Tangle within Mrykgard and recover materials for Boundless Ward's grip.
The Myrkgard's weapon stores lie deeper within. Defeat the Corrupted and acquire broken shields to construct your own.
Conquer the Darkness and slay Archmagister Vocus for his protective charm.

A Spear to Pierce the Heavens
Recollection of a Journey
Book One: Nostos
Book Two: Elegeia
Book Three: Parodos
Book Four: Akron
Book Five: Istia
Book Six: Pyrgos
Book Seven: Hesukhia
The odyssey of an unnamed Ancient Guardian, trace their steps and find clues for the Heavensplitter.

I saw in the sky the beauty of the heavens, marveling at the sight of stars and the dance of lights. As I drew lines between the heavenly bodies, I split the heavens with my finger. I shared with my comrades the stories of these beings in the sky, as well as my own story. Such stories precede my birth, and will survive me for ages.

As I began my journey, I found first myself searching in the cays at the foot of the island. It took me to the top of a magnificent tower, and I pondered how our yearning for the sky drives the construction of these towers. To Holm, I entrusted my post, and visited the caverns south.

The stars above the caverns pointed me northeast. There, I found an isle that was closer to the Underworld than anything I ever seen. I descended into a realm where my soul was torn asunder by Hades himself. There, I fought his hellhound, and from that frothy maw stole a gem sky blue. I knew it was a sign.

As I trekked the Underworld, I found myself in its swamps. The chorus of voices crying out rang through the fog. I could sense the souls of those around me, and yet I could do naught but listen. Phantoms calling out in song, not unlike the Kokytos. I knew that I must transport this gem as a trial, and succeed where others have failed.

I waded through the swamps and, like a siren's song, I again found myself at another tower. I saw beings of the earth, the dryads, patrolling Eridanus that was entrusted to them. At its humble base, I shared the gem with these primordial protectors. They anointed it with a tear of azoth whose purity was unmatched. What a brilliant sight.

My journey was becoming clearer to me. To pierce the sky, the fates were bringing me to the many towers that dot the island. It brought me then to a tower in the valley of mourning. The tower stood like a solemn watcher. I met with the soldier at the top, and shared with him my story. To find a kindred soldier on this island is rare.

The final tower the fates brought me to was one ruled by the earth, and the dryads that protect it. In a land that birthed life here on this island, I climbed the tower searching for guidance. The guardians there tested my strength, and rewarded my spirit with a spearshaft made of an ancient, blessed wood.

My journey was coming to a close, my ultimate test was found the badlands choked by red: the Mangled Heights. I stood at the summit. I fastened sharp tendrils to the spearshaft, and affixed the skygem to purify my spear. I took my spear and leapt to the heavens, splitting them in pieces. Day shattered, giving its fractured lights to the Night sky, and I rested among the stars.

I have been translating a section of the texts you recovered for Madaki, and I found something truly spectacular.\n\nIt is a ballad of a Legendary Spear known as 'Heavensplitter,' and it tells how to forge it.
"That sounds interesting."

Indeed, it is the story of an Ancient Guardian who undertook an odyssey for this weapon. \n\nFollow the poem wherever it leads, and bring what you find to Madaki, and earn yourself a spear that will pierce the sky.
The Heavensplitter, could it be from the Heavens? Or the deepest pits of the Underworld?\n\nEither way, it will be a weapon of great power.

Ah, the elements needed to forge the revered spear. A beautiful poem, wasn't it?\n\nVery well, this shall be a weapon above all others. Behold… the 'Heavensplitter'! Even the skys cannot hold you down, now.

Defeat {targetName}
Aria of a Frozen Lament
Frostbitten Cabriole
Icy Arabesque
Seaside Echappé
Glacial Enchainment
Frigid Relevé
Wintry Pirouette
Bitter Battement
Snowy Sissonne
The song and dance of a legendary rapier whose steps must be followed precisely to complete.
A Cabriole: A jump to The Tangle.
An Arabesque: A position on one leg with the other behind in Malevolence.
An Echappé: A jump from first, third, or fifth position to second or fourth position and returning to Svikin's Stand.
An Enchainment: A combination chain of steps leading to Mourningdale.
A Relevé: To rise with a small upwards action starting with bent knees in Periville.
A Pirouette: To turn in dance towards Stone Skull Fort.
A Battement: A movement with a closing action towards Eridanus.
A Scissone: A jump from two feet to two feet in Mangled Heights.
"I'm told you're a rapier expert."
To wield a rapier is to know the dance of combat, the sweeping highs and lows of dexterous swordplay. There is one such blade that we can put together with reagents from across the island.
"How do we assemble it?"
We gather parts from around Aeternum. Can you dance to the song of this blade, Frozen Lament? We shall see. First, we must assemble her.

Never look down upon the noble career of a dancer as frivolous, for you must become one to flourish and twirl this tempered orichalcum razor. \n\nYour enemies will quiver in fear to see your beautiful, ever-evolving, monstrous movements.
This weapon is powerful indeed, and it is yours to look after now. \n\nTake it; go forth and send the Corrupted to an icy hell colder than the broken mountain they occupy.
You have proven to be a hero even among Soulwardens, my friend.\n\nI think it only fitting that a hero such as yourself wields a worthy weapon.
I am curious about this 'Tempest', or should I call her Isabella? \n\nReturn when you are stronger and we might be able to find out more about her together.
A collection of pages about Isabella de Leon.
Enter the Tempest's Heart Expedition
Defeat {targetName}

Defeat {targetName}

Read Lore Note 'Father Russo and Isabella'
Enter the Tempest's Heart Expedition
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName}
Defeat {targetName}
The Tempest's Soul (Expedition)
Enter Tempest's Heart and Defeat Isabella de Leon.

I am Mara Rosa. I have managed to make my way to Aeternum and to this broken mountain in search of knowledge. But I dare not enter this unholy place. \n\nYou, however, you might be the one I've been searching for.
"You need someone to delve inside?"

Precisely. You have no doubt heard of the Tempest and have come seeking her ruin. But what do you know of Captain Isabella? What does anyone know? \n\nI intend to discover what madness drove her to this point.
"How do you intend to do that?"

This place is not just a fortress, it's a window into the mind of Isabella de Leon. Inside you will find a phantasmagoria, a construct that the sane would find impossible. \n\nThis is where the waking world and nightmares combine. Where Isabella's mind and memories shape reality. Enter and you will see what I mean.
I have found accounts scattered across this island by those who had contact with Isabella. The story they tell is grim. \n\nBut this place can reveal which accounts were true and which were false.

So it is true… Isabella de Leon is no more. This is only the beginning. \n\nTo fully understand how a god-fearing, upstanding citizen of Spain could become such a monster will require delving deeper into Isabella's reality.
Isabella De Leon (Expedition)
Find out about Isabella's past in Spain with her brothers. Then defeat Isabella de Leon again with this new knowledge in mind.
What of Isabella's family? The name of de Leon was once respected by the people of Spain. \n\nI know Isabella lost her parents, Lord and Lady de Leon, when she was a girl.
"I'd never concerned her parents."

We all have family. She also had brothers. Could they have stopped Isabella's descent into madness? 

I myself am an only child. I often wished for the love and comfort of a sibling, to help ease my woes. 

Were her brothers of any help?
"Doubtful, considering her fall."
Yes, that would seem the case. \n\nBut we must learn more to be sure. Please, enter once more into Isabella's mind. Perhaps there we can find something new.
I am curious to know whether our ill-fated Captain had help or hindrance from her brothers. \n\nI have wondered this for a long time…

Ah, so Philip and Cosimo squandered their fortune and family name away. It's no wonder Isabella became so isolated and desperate. \n\nI had hoped she would've found some comfort in family. Perhaps I was naïve. It would not be the first time.
Isabella's Corruption (Expedition)
Find out about how Isabella was offered the mantle of Corruption. Then defeat Isabella de Leon with this new knowledge in mind.

The documents across the island speak of a man with no name, but a chilling title: The Heretic. He was at Isabella's side from the journey's start. \n\nDid he lure Isabella into darkness? Did she resist him? Or was it as easy as leading a child?
"I don't think she resisted long."

But how can we know for sure? \n\nI used to be a sister of the cloth before my arrival on Aeternum. If there is even the slightesst hope for Isabella's soul, then I must know if she resisted the Heretic.
"You think you can save her soul?"

No, I do not have that power. I am not God. 

She must face Judgement Day like all the rest of us. 

I simply wish to know if there is any hope for her.
I left my convent to discover all I could about Isabella. The rumors of her fate frightened me. But they also piqued my interest. \n\nCould such a place as Aeternum truly exist?

It was a swift downfall then. Isabella ate the forbidden fruit with no remorse. This is... disheartening. \n\nI had heard so many stories of her kindness, her nobility, her courage in the face of adversity.
Rise of Captain Isabella (Expedition)
Find out about Isabella's descent into cruelty with her crew by investigating the graves where they were buried alive. Then defeat Isabella de Leon with this new knowledge in mind.
Now that we know Isabella willingly embraced Corruption, I am curious if any of her humanity remained. \n\nThere are tales of the treatment of her crew. They do not paint a flattering portrait.
"I would imagine not."
Still, I must believe that some part of the noble woman remained. \n\nSurely there must have been a place in her heart for someone? A person dear to her?
"I'm guessing Isabella had no one."
It is a sad thought. \n\nI would like you to search for any trace of mercy, any sign of concern for the souls she brought to Aeternum. A grave marker, perhaps? Something to show she remembers them?
Please discover more about Isabella's trek across the island. \n\nWas it true her crew mutinied? A captain would have to punish mutineers, wouldn't they?
She buried them alive? Oh God, she condemned them to the earth, a terrible fate on Aeternum. \n\nHow could she have done this?
Death of the Heretic (Expedition)
Find out about the Heretic's true power and talk to the Heretic. Then defeat Isabella de Leon with this new knowledge in mind.
It must have been this Heretic who polluted her mind and forced her to commit such atrocities. \n\nThis demon must have been acting through her. That is the only answer!
"You seem driven to exonerate her."

She was misled! That much I know for sure. Is the Heretic the source of Corruption? That would explain it. \n\nThat is the only way to explain my aunt's transformation! The monster in these tales does not match the woman I knew.
"Wait, Isabella's your aunt?"

Yes, yes, I am Mara de Leon, Isabella's niece. 

I knew her when I was a child. She was so kind and good. 

To think that my father may have driven Isabella to desperation pains me. 

 Please, bring me proof it was the Heretic's fault.
Aunt Isabella was as beautiful as an angel. She was devout and prayed at Church often. \n\nIt was she who inspired me to pursue life at the convent. She was a saint to me.
You bring me a name I have never heard before: Nedenyek. It chills my very soul. \n\nIs that the Heretic's true name? It must be the name of the Devil himself! The Beast!
The Possession of Russo (Expedition)
Find out the truth about Isabella and Father Russo, and what is to come, and talk to Father Russo. Then defeat Isabella de Leon with this new knowledge in mind.

There was a priest who travelled with Isabella. He sought to save her from the Heretic. 

His name was Father Russo. I served in the Church with him. 

His love for Isabella matched my own. It even ran deeper.
"Did Isabella return his love?"
I do not know. Perhaps it is as you said - Isabella had no one. \n\nWhat a tragic possibility. To feel utterly alone in the world...
"That doesn't excuse her choices."

No, it doesn't. But it also doesn't change who she once was. Kind, gentle, intelligent, someone curious about life. \n\nPlease, try to contact the Father Russo that may still exist in her heart. Perhaps she wasn't utterly alone.
In another life, perhaps Father Russo and Isabella could have been together. We will never know.
So she turned away from Father Russo, who loved her with all of his heart. \n\nMy aunt is truly lost to me. I will say a prayer for her soul.
Isabella's Madness (Expedition)
Recover a shard of Isabella's madness in the ashes of her defeat for Mara Rosa to study.

Everything we have learned has revealed a great truth: those who were meant to protect Isabella all failed her. Including me. \n\nMy penance is to stay here, at the door to her soul, and relive our failures.
"Her example serves as a lesson."
That seems just.\n\nMy Aunt Isabella deserves to have her story told and understood in its entirety. We must leave nothing out.
"How can I find these memories?"
Every time you defeat her, a Shard of Madness will remain. \n\nBring me these Shards and I will reward you.

Have you collected another Shard of Madness? 

Perhaps these memories will help point a way toward her salvation someday. 

We must always have hope.

This Shard of Madness is full of pain. I shall store it with the others. \n\nPerhaps one day, Aeternum shall have a full portrait of the woman I knew. The captain, the legend, the terror: Isabella de Leon.
Talk to the Heretic
Talk to Father Russo
Enter the Gate of Madness
Enter the Cellar of Despair
Enter the City of Darkness
The ropes… bound tight… What do they bind? What do they hold? \n\nThe writhing chaos cannot be bound... The endless dark cannot be held… hehehehe...
The screams… they sing like a choir… a lovely chorus of suffering...
I am lost in the dark... I cannot find my way… Is this hell…?

She abandoned me in the dark… She never loved me... 

My love turns to dust in my hands, bile in my mouth… 

Something approaches… something calls to me… Dear God, save my soul…
I'm Master Fisher Bernard, by the way.
I worry that the Corruption-Tinged Fish will start popping up all over Aeternum…
I have seen mysteries far beyond your ken {playerName}.
So you come seeking the lost?\nWhen the mind is unbound, there are no limits to it's sight.
We need to band together in these dark times. Armor, teamwork, strategy… we need to use everything we have.
Found three damaged wagons this week. One had weapons, the other food, the third crafting equipment.
I heard you defeated the Corrupted within their strongholds. Is any loot left for the picking?
The longer the bow, the stronger it is. The stronger the bow, the faster and farther your arrow goes.
Hardwoods are good for making recurve bows. You'll want to equip one of Qasim's if you're facing the Corrupted camps here.
Well done against the Corrupted! I was helping you from the shadows. You may have seen one of my arrows fly by.
I don't understand war against humans. But war against the Corrupted? That I do understand.
